fields.summary: Disabled trackbacks log errors

fields.description:
# Open up a dashboard with a filter results.
# Open one of the issues from filters results in another tab.
# Delete the issue from the second tab.
# From the original tab click on the issues cog.

You will get a NPE like:

{code:none}
java.lang.NullPointerException
        at com.atlassian.jira.rest.v1.issues.IssueActionsAndOperationsResource.getActionsAndOperations(IssueActionsAndOperationsResource.java:93)
        at com.atlassian.jira.rest.v1.issues.IssueActionsAndOperationsResource.getActionsAndOperationsResponse(IssueActionsAndOperationsResource.java:81)
        at sun.reflect.GeneratedMethodAccessor496.invoke(Unknown Source)
        at sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.java:25)
        at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:597)
        at com.atlassian.plugins.rest.common.interceptor.impl.DispatchProviderHelper$ResponseOutInvoker$1.invoke(DispatchProviderHelper.java:206)
        at com.atlassian.plugins.rest.common.interceptor.impl.DispatchProviderHelper$1.intercept(DispatchProviderHelper.java:90)
        at com.atlassian.plugins.rest.common.interceptor.impl.DefaultMethodInvocation.invoke(DefaultMethodInvocation.java:61)
        at com.atlassian.plugins.rest.common.expand.interceptor.ExpandInterceptor.intercept(ExpandInterceptor.java:38)
        at com.atlassian.plugins.rest.common.interceptor.impl.DefaultMethodInvocation.invoke(DefaultMethodInvocation.java:61)
        at com.atlassian.plugins.rest.common.interceptor.impl.DispatchProviderHelper.invokeMethodWithInterceptors(DispatchProviderHelper.java:98)
        at com.atlassian.plugins.rest.common.interceptor.impl.DispatchProviderHelper.access$100(DispatchProviderHelper.java:28)
        at com.atlassian.plugins.rest.common.interceptor.impl.DispatchProviderHelper$ResponseOutInvoker._dispatch(DispatchProviderHelper.java:202)
        at com.sun.jersey.server.impl.model.method.dispatch.ResourceJavaMethodDispatcher.dispatch(ResourceJavaMethodDispatcher.java:67)
        at com.sun.jersey.server.impl.uri.rules.HttpMethodRule.accept(HttpMethodRule.java:163)
        at com.sun.jersey.server.impl.uri.rules.SubLocatorRule.accept(SubLocatorRule.java:105)
        at com.sun.jersey.server.impl.uri.rules.RightHandPathRule.accept(RightHandPathRule.java:111)
        at com.sun.jersey.server.impl.uri.rules.ResourceClassRule.accept(ResourceClassRule.java:71)
        at com.sun.jersey.server.impl.uri.rules.RightHandPathRule.accept(RightHandPathRule.java:111)
        at com.sun.jersey.server.impl.uri.rules.RootResourceClassesRule.accept(RootResourceClassesRule.java:63)
{code}

From the dashboard UI side you see:

!dashboard_bad.png!

You can do a similar thing on the navigator where you will get:

!navigator_bad.png!

We should not throw the NPE on the server. For more points, it would be nice if the cog told you that the issue could not be found and that it was likely deleted.
fields.summary: Trying to click the COG menu of an issue that no longer exists causes a NPE on the server

fields.description:
If you middle-click an image thumbnail, it should open the image in full in a new tab (handy in cases where large screenshots have been attached and you want to see them full-size). 

In Safari and IE, middle-clicking is treated the same as left-clicking; it pops up the gallery in the same tab.

This may be part of the problem that this guy raised:
JRADEV-2889

*Note -* this issue does not include fixing the problem where you cannot right click an image that appears in the gallery, and have that image appear in a new tab.
fields.summary: Can't middle-click image thumbnails to view in new tab in Safari and IE

fields.description:
* go to the view issue page
* activate the top-of-page comment form ("m")
* activate a dropdown like a subtask cog or subtask-filter triange (see screenshots)
* scroll the page so that the dropdown scrolls near the comment form
* *Actual*: the dropdown goes above the form
* *Desired*: the dropdown should be part of the "page" and be under the form

* actually, you don't need to activate the comment form: all those dropdowns seem to scroll above the stalker area
fields.summary: dropdowns go over the "m" comment form when you scroll

fields.description:
When you open a dropdown that increases the size of the page in Safari on Windows, all sorts of weirdness happens.

!SafariCraziness.png!

Looks to be a Safari bug but I'm hoping we can trigger a refresh, because this is pretty dodgy-looking.

http://screencast.com/t/YTFiMGZmNTg
fields.summary: Page doesn't redraw properly in Safari on Windows

fields.description:
Example

Paul Slade updated JRADEV-3460:
-------------------------------

    Fix Version/s: 4.3
           Labels: dialogs focus keyboard triaged ui  (was: dialogs focus keyboard ui)
           Status: ToDo  (was: ToDo)

From an end-users perspective, it does not make too much sense to say that the status changed from ToDo to ToDo.
fields.summary: When there is an issue transition notification emails get sent out saying the status has changed even if it hasn't
[consistency] Comment visibility uses different naming convention for issue/comments and for transitions

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:

# Obtain a permalink to an issue comment (found on the view issue page)
# Paste this URL into the location bar in IE (or click on a link pointing here, or add a comment which redirects to this kind of URL)
# Press the Home or End keys.

Actual behaviour:

Nothing happens. Even when you click on the <body> to ensure no elements have focus, these keys don't work. This affects IE7 only.

Expected behaviour:

The page should scroll to the beginning or end.
fields.summary: Home and End keys don't work in IE7 when URL contains #

fields.description:
1. Go to the create issue screen.
2. Go to the labels field.
3. Start entering some text and hit ESC.
4. The text is in the field, but no booger has been added.
5. *[BUG]* Press ENTER... Nothing happens. I would expect a booger to be created.
fields.summary: After hitting ESC on the labels field ENTER does not create a booger

fields.description:
Example:
Steps:
1. Login to JIRA.
2. View any issue.
3. Select "Link issue" from . dialog or from stalker bar.
4. User by mistake enter a invalid issue key.
5. Press enter to submit the form.

Result:
1. User get a proper error message " The issue key "XXX" does not exist.", after that the focus is on "This issue" dropdown and not on "issues" field.
2. In IE the focus is no where on the dialog after error message.
fields.summary: Focus should be back on first field with error

fields.description: If I type this into the environment system field: {noformat}http:///path{noformat} The < and > are double-escaped inside the resulting : {noformat}http://<server-name>{noformat} I get this: !double-esc.png! When I want this: !single-esc.png!
fields.summary: Double escaping of link text in Environment system field

fields.description:
The search tab on the manage filters page is kinda confusing, when you open it you notice a pair of fields to the left, a huge amount of horizontal white-space and then a user picker to your left.

It is really unclear whether the user is supposed to enter data in all the fields or in one of the field "groups"(even though there is only one search button :-S) to perform a search. See screenshot.

It seems like this form needs a bit of JT / UX / Usability love.
fields.summary: The manage filters-->search tab lacks usability, I don't understand how to use it

fields.description:
Mr Stephen Russell picked this one up on a Mac:
- on EACJ (Confluence Project) some drop downs are blurry

When checking on my PC:
- drop downs were all sharp but displayed at different heights

Are these two oddities related or is it just coincidence?

See attached screen shots
fields.summary: create issue drop downs inconsistent height on PC and blurry on Mac

fields.description:
*Steps*
# Go to the Dashboard (possibly creating a new one) and click 'Add Gadget.'
# Start typing into the search in the top right to narrow down the results
# Click the 'x' in the search field to clear the search term.

*Expected*
- All the gadgets are displayed.

*Actual*
- Only the narrowed down list of gadgets from step 2 are displayed.

If you then press backspace in the search field, we get the expected behaviour.
fields.summary: Clearing gadget search via Safari's native button doesn't update the list of gadgets

fields.description: !log_work.png!
fields.summary: The 'Date Started' field is compulsory on the Log Work field but there is no compulsory '*'

fields.description:
Investigate change in the name of one of the name spaces above.

If JIRA is going to use its own custom drop down menu code it should probably be under the jira. name space, and we should document that we use only that.
fields.summary: AJS.Dropdown and AJS.dropDown are different but very similar things.

fields.description:
# Restore [^data.xml].
# Goto XSS-15
# Bring up the "Resolve Issue" dialog.
# Fill in "8" and "aaa" using the multi-user picker for the "Moar people with a longer name" field.
# Open the multi-user picker again for the "Moar people with a longer name" field.
# [BUG]  Without selecting any user click 'select'. Notice that the field now has ", 8, aaa" entered.

The diaog can still be submitted correctly with the extraneous comma.
fields.summary: Selecting nothing in the 'Multi User Picker' leaves an extraneous comma in its associated field.

fields.description:
In 4.1.2, the page you reach after successfully changing your password had a "Cancel" link that took you back to the User Profile. In 4.2 this has gone.

Marked as Minor because you can only reach this page by middle-clicking the "Change Password" link on the User Profile.
fields.summary: No "Cancel" link from the Change Password Success page

fields.description: Check out [^ie7_cog_now.mov]. You will notice that I can select the link behind the menu by placing my cursor between the menu elements (e.g. between log work and attachments). This is a little jarring to the user.
fields.summary: IE7 Menu from the COG seems to have gaps were the element behind is selected.

fields.description: are we going for colons for field labels?  On view issue we have colons, on edit we don't.  On inline comment we have a colon
fields.summary: Let's get consistent with colons on field labels

fields.description:
Steps:

1.- Go to the View Issue page.
2.- Press "."
3.- Select the "Comment" operation.
4.- Enter the text for the comment.
5.- Press "Add".
6.- [BUG] Notice that the view issue page is reloaded, but the focus is not set on the comment that was added.
fields.summary: Commenting on an issue through the dot control does not focus on the added comment

fields.description:
Rejecting as the bug is still reproducible in IE7 and IE8 following these steps:

1. Bring up the Issue Nav and perform a new search (not a saved filter) that returns at least 10 issues.
2. Click Views->On Dashboard.
3. Scroll down the issue list till you reach the cog. This works OK.
4. Click on the cog and select Edit.
5. Click on Cancel.
6. [BUG] Scroll down the issue list and notice that the cog is cut off again.

You can also reproduce this in Safari 4 by:

1. Bring up the Issue Nav and perform a new search (not a saved filter) that returns at least 10 issues.
2. Click Views->On Dashboard.
3. Scroll down the issue list till you reach the cog. This works OK.
4. Click on the cog and select Edit.
5. Click on Cancel.
6. Click on the cog again and select Edit.
7. Click on Cancel again.
6. [BUG] Scroll down the issue list and notice that the cog is cut off again.
fields.summary: Issues with Filter Results gadget not resizing in IssueNav dialog

fields.description: Remove the text "You are currently using a new, unsaved filter" from the issue navigator screen.
fields.summary: Remove the text "You are currently using a new, unsaved filter" from simple search navigator

fields.description:
h4. 1. The styling of errors in the Quick Create inline popup is non-existant.

!quick-create-error.jpg!

h4. 2. When a user first logs in, there is no 'last issue type' set and so the Issue Type dropdown defaults to the value "please select".

!quick-create-focus.jpg!

The problem is, the focus is set to the Submit button by default. Thus, users can't use the keyboard to submit this dialog.

If there is no issue type selected, then the issue type should have default focus. Similarly for projects (though I'm not sure if its possible to not have a project automatically selected)

h4. 3. The Submit button doesn't always have focus when the popup is opened.

Whether or not the Submit button should have focus is one thing, but if you open the dialog, close it again (using 'ESC'), click around the page you are on a few times (just on text and random spaces), and then open the dialog again, the focus is not immediately put on the Submit button. The dialog should reset the focus whenever it is opened, not just on the first time.

This happens on all browsers.
fields.summary: Quick Create inline popup focus and styling issues

fields.description:
The 'SetupImport' and 'XmlRestore' do not look for files from the same location (see JRADEV-2997). When you type in a bad filename you get "Could not find file at this location". It would be nice if it is not a security concern to display which file(s) it tried to load.

h5. SetupImport.
# Start JIRA with empty database.
# Click "Import You Existing Data"
# Type in a filename that does not exist.
# [BUG] Click Import. You end up with an error message "Could not find file at this location". I expect to get a full path to the file it was trying to load.

h5. XmlRestore.
# Start JIRA with non-empty database.
# Goto Admin > Restore Data from XML
# Type in a filename that does not exist.
# [BUG] Click Restore. You end up with an error message "Could not find file at this location". I expect to get a full path to the file it was trying to load.
fields.summary: When you type the wrong filename in the 'SetupImport' or the 'XmlRestore' you get generic error message that is confusing.

fields.summary: ShowChartReport.jspa is constantly generating log messages in JAC complaining about non-found users or something. Probably caused by anonymous users, expired sessions...
Hardcoded English text in custom fields code

fields.description:
- Open the same issue in 2 tabs
- Add a vote on one (server state is now "Voted")
- Add a vote on the other and a JS error is displayed (see attachment)
fields.summary: Vote error received when voted state out of sync with the server

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-22871].
  {panel}

Here's the issue as described by Stephen:

"At the moment, thumbnails in the attachments section interact differently to thumbnails in comments. In the attachments section, when clicked JIRA pops up a full size version of the image but clicking a thumbnail in the comments prompts me to download the image. I expect them both to act in exactly the same way (the first way).
 
One more thing is that when right clicking to open an image in a new tab I am always prompted to download the image. I am unable to preview in the browser (as I was able to before 4.0)."


Is this something we can address and if so do we need to create diagrams or mock-ups to explain the solution?

My take is that the new attachments functionality has introduced some inconsistencies within the View Issue page and also with previous versions of JIRA. Ideally we need to make the behaviours consistent and have right mouse click and open in new tab working as expected.

Please come and chat if you need more info.

!viewing_attachments.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: View images using consistent and existing behaviour

fields.description: See https://atlaseye.atlassian.com/cru/CR-JRA-298#c28131 for details.
fields.summary: Avoid IO operations on thumbnails while serving thumbnail info in AttachmentResource

fields.description:
When you create an issue it is indexed twice. The first from the IssueReIndexFunction and the second from the IssueIndexListener. I can't believe this is intentional. We will need to check if this behavior existed in 3.13, 4.0 (i.e. pre issue service) or 4.1.

Notice that the IssueReIndexFunction and IssueIndexListener are fired when we perform a workflow transition after we create an issue, however, in the SimpleWorkflowManager.doWorkflowAction we disable indexing and as such is not a problem in this case.

h2. IssueReIndexFunction

{noformat}
http-8090-Processor8@9700 daemon, prio=5, in group 'main', status: 'runnable'
  java.lang.Thread.State: RUNNABLE
	  at com.atlassian.jira.issue.index.DefaultIndexManager.reIndexIssues(DefaultIndexManager.java:305)
	  at com.atlassian.jira.issue.index.DefaultIndexManager.reIndexIssues(DefaultIndexManager.java:266)
	  at com.atlassian.jira.issue.index.DefaultIndexManager.reIndex(DefaultIndexManager.java:292)
	  at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke0(NativeMethodAccessorImpl.java:-1)
	  at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(NativeMethodAccessorImpl.java:39)
	  at sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.java:25)
	  at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:597)
	  at com.atlassian.util.profiling.object.ObjectProfiler.profiledInvoke(ObjectProfiler.java:73)
	  at com.atlassian.jira.config.component.SwitchingInvocationHandler.invoke(SwitchingInvocationHandler.java:28)
	  at $Proxy81.reIndex(Unknown Source:-1)
	  at com.atlassian.jira.workflow.function.issue.IssueReindexFunction.execute(IssueReindexFunction.java:29)
	  at com.opensymphony.workflow.AbstractWorkflow.executeFunction(AbstractWorkflow.java:869)
	  at com.opensymphony.workflow.AbstractWorkflow.transitionWorkflow(AbstractWorkflow.java:1265)
	  at com.opensymphony.workflow.AbstractWorkflow.initialize(AbstractWorkflow.java:618)
	  at com.atlassian.jira.workflow.SimpleWorkflowManager.createIssue(SimpleWorkflowManager.java:219)
{noformat}

h2. IssueIndexListener

{noformat}
http-8090-Processor8@9700 daemon, prio=5, in group 'main', status: 'runnable'
  java.lang.Thread.State: RUNNABLE
	  at com.atlassian.jira.issue.index.DefaultIndexManager.reIndexIssues(DefaultIndexManager.java:305)
	  at com.atlassian.jira.issue.index.DefaultIndexManager.reIndexIssues(DefaultIndexManager.java:266)
	  at com.atlassian.jira.issue.index.DefaultIndexManager.reIndexIssueObjects(DefaultIndexManager.java:276)
	  at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke0(NativeMethodAccessorImpl.java:-1)
	  at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(NativeMethodAccessorImpl.java:39)
	  at sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.java:25)
	  at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:597)
	  at com.atlassian.util.profiling.object.ObjectProfiler.profiledInvoke(ObjectProfiler.java:73)
	  at com.atlassian.jira.config.component.SwitchingInvocationHandler.invoke(SwitchingInvocationHandler.java:28)
	  at $Proxy81.reIndexIssueObjects(Unknown Source:-1)
	  at com.atlassian.jira.event.listeners.search.IssueIndexListener.reIndex(IssueIndexListener.java:155)
	  at com.atlassian.jira.event.listeners.search.IssueIndexListener.issueCreated(IssueIndexListener.java:58)
	  at com.atlassian.jira.event.issue.AbstractIssueEventListener.workflowEvent(AbstractIssueEventListener.java:96)
	  at com.atlassian.jira.event.issue.IssueEventListenerHandler$IssueEventInvoker.invoke(IssueEventListenerHandler.java:49)
	  at com.atlassian.event.internal.AsynchronousAbleEventDispatcher$2.run(AsynchronousAbleEventDispatcher.java:60)
	  at com.atlassian.event.internal.AsynchronousAbleEventDispatcher$1.execute(AsynchronousAbleEventDispatcher.java:28)
	  at com.atlassian.event.internal.AsynchronousAbleEventDispatcher.dispatch(AsynchronousAbleEventDispatcher.java:56)
	  at com.atlassian.event.internal.EventPublisherImpl.invokeListeners(EventPublisherImpl.java:145)
	  at com.atlassian.event.internal.EventPublisherImpl.publish(EventPublisherImpl.java:67)
	  at com.atlassian.jira.event.issue.IssueEventDispatcher.dispatchEvent(IssueEventDispatcher.java:126)
	  at com.atlassian.jira.event.issue.IssueEventDispatcher.dispatchEvent(IssueEventDispatcher.java:85)
	  at com.atlassian.jira.workflow.function.event.FireIssueEventFunction.execute(FireIssueEventFunction.java:60)
	  at com.opensymphony.workflow.AbstractWorkflow.executeFunction(AbstractWorkflow.java:869)
	  at com.opensymphony.workflow.AbstractWorkflow.transitionWorkflow(AbstractWorkflow.java:1265)
	  at com.opensymphony.workflow.AbstractWorkflow.initialize(AbstractWorkflow.java:618)
	  at com.atlassian.jira.workflow.SimpleWorkflowManager.createIssue(SimpleWorkflowManager.java:219)
{noformat}
fields.summary: The issue is indexed twice when you create it.
username in URI path for adding and removing watchers - needs escaping or moving to query parameters if we are to support username with slashes

fields.description:
The screenshot page has some JS to redirect the user to SUN to download the JRE if they don't have it installed. After it installed the JRE I was redirected me to http://https//bbain:8443/secure/AttachScreenshot!default.jspa?id=10459 rather than https://bbain:8443/secure/AttachScreenshot!default.jspa?id=10459. 

# Get a Windows VM that never had a Java JRE installed on it. 
# Open IE8.
# Goto an issue.
# Try to "Attach a Screenshot"
# You will be given a popup. Note that we will be directecd to Oracle/Sun.
# Install the JRE.
# After the JRE is installed you will be directed to the bad URL.

This is all captured in [^jre_edited.mov]. HTTPS may be an issue here.
fields.summary: The attach screenshot page does not redirect to the correct URL after downloading the JRE

fields.description:
not sure when and why we dropped colons from form elements....we need to add them back to be consistent with the view issue page. Confluence also still uses colons in forms.

Some articles on accessibility and colon usage:
http://www.usabilitynews.com/news/article3112.asp
http://www.usabilitynews.com/news/article3200.asp
http://www.slideshare.net/AcuityETS/using-eye-tracking-to-analyse-form-design

The general consensus is to pick a style and stick with it. It seems AUI forms is introducing an inconsistency and we should fix that.
fields.summary: Forms change: reinstate colons in all forms
The summary field on the "sub task quick create" is not marked as compulsory.

fields.description:
I'd expect a valid JSON here with some message about invalid credentials rather than plain HTML.

priority only minor, because HTTP 401 code is correctly returned.
fields.summary: HTML returned for POST at <JIRA_URL>rest/auth/latest/session when credentials are invalid

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-22863].
  {panel}

I have a user called "fred" with the password "fred".

Whenever I try to authenticate as him using basic auth and the wrong password, the Current Failed Login Count increases by 2, not 1.

With CAPTCHA set to required after 3 failures, this means it is instead requiring CAPTCHA after 2 failures.

Before the attempt:
!1FredBeforeLogin.png!

Bad login request: (the credentials are fred:notfred)
!2FredBadLoginRequest.png!

Unauthorised response:
!3FredBadLoginResponse.png!

Value is incorrect:
!4FredIncorrectLoginCount.png!
fields.summary: Each failed login attempt via basic auth increases the failed login count by 2

fields.description:
In the default language in the Global settings lists and allows the user to select "English (Australia) [Default]" as the global language, but when editing you user profile the list of user selectable languages does not include "English (Australia)" unless it is the current default.

In the personal profile settings if you have the default selected, it is shown in a misleading manner as English (Australia) [Default], where as it should really be shown as "Default (English Australian)" as you have selected the default and not English Australian.  If the default changes, the users language will also change, because they are using the default.
fields.summary: Choosing languages is confusing and a little bit wrong

fields.description: See JRADEV-2067 for more details.
fields.summary: Dashboard Tabs do not display focus

fields.description:
also see this discussion [https://extranet.atlassian.com/display/~mcompton/2010/09/16/Hey+HTML5,+u+r+so+fake...]

HTML5 browsers are _required_ to put some {{fakepath}} crap at the front of {{input.value}} for file uploads. We should stip it off when displaying that value as a status message (See screenshot).

[This part|http://www.w3.org/TR/html5/number-state.html#file-upload-state] of the html5 specs contains a description/code of how to clean the value for display (basically: just use the suffix after the last slash or slosh).
fields.summary: remove C:\fakepath\ prefix when displaying status message of uploading files

fields.description:
After attaching a screenshot you are always taken to manage attachments. This happens:

* From COG menu on dashboard [What should happen: back to dashboard].
* From COG menu on the navigator [back to navigator].
* From Operations Dialog on the issue [back to issue].
* From Operations Dialog on the navigator [back to navigator].

fields.description:
When typing a long comment, the textarea in the comment dialog eventually shows a scroll bar and limits the overall height:
!http://img.skitch.com/20101001-qwdqyhcm94iyiea5ucyp8pmmry.png!

However if you switch to wiki preview it doesn't show a scrollbar and you end up with a pretty long dialog:
!http://img.skitch.com/20101001-cg53riq6rsg52ub55k7iemi31e.png!

In the stalker bar the wiki preview is limited in height and will get a scroll bar.  I think all we need to do to fix this is to set a maxHeight css property for the textarea in the dialog (like we do in the stalker). The wiki preview js already picks this css property up.
fields.summary: Wiki preview doesn't limit height in add comment dialog

fields.description:
For all the stalker-bar actions, middle-clicking (or right-clicking and selecting "Open in New Tab") opens the relevant form in a new tab/window. 

However, middle-clicking the bottom comment button opens a new tab/window that contains the View Issue page, not the Add Comment page. It works fine for the top comment button.
fields.summary: Middle-clicking the bottom comment button opens the View Issue page

fields.description:
Noticing over VPN that the FC's are taking a few seconds to draw. 

The potentially confusing thing is that the help text appears first, right next to the label, and then the FC's draw in and the form reflows.

Might reflect some polish if we put a throbber in there with the correct scrollHeight:
a) lets people know something is still loading/drawing
b) stops the form from jumping around when the FCs finally appear.
fields.summary: FC: Slow connections -> throbbers?

fields.description: We changed the name of the activity stream issue tab to just "Activity" (also in German, French & Japanese).  Everywhere else (Gadget, browse project, profile page) we still call it Activity Stream.  We should make this consistent to just say Activity. Also the current German translation for Activity Stream (Activitaetsstrom) is pretty poor. Just "Aktivitaet" would be better everywhere anyways.
fields.summary: Activity stream naming is inconsistent

fields.description:

h5. Steps to reproduce 

# Open up an issue.
# Open the comment dialog.
# Try to tab to the "Cancel" link. You will get to the submit button and then will just loop back around to the comment.

I tested this under HTTPS.

fields.description:
Currently, we're doing a page refresh to enable / disable autocomplete. The fix for JRADEV-2355 has the issue that we get a dirty page warning if we start typing our query before enabling/disabling autocomplete. 

At the moment, the autocomplete.js is only included if autocomplete is enabled, we need to change this so,
# autocomplete.js is always included
# autocomplete only works if the checkbox is enabled.
# autocomplete div's are hidden if autocomplete is disabled
fields.summary: Dynamically enable/disable auto-complete for JQL queries

fields.description:

Should it be ∑ instead? (Presumably spread-sheet users are familiar with seeing that icon on their toolbar etc, so it shouldn't be too esoteric?)

Or at least have a tooltip saying "Total".
fields.summary: What does T: mean on the 2D filter stats gadget? It should be ∑ or have a tooltop

fields.description:
Links to a user's profile on the user hover full name and avatar were introduced in JRADEV-2084.

The links appear for anonymous users, but the profile is not available to view, so they get a login page instead.

This behaviour is not consistent with Confluence. In Confluence, if user profiles are restricted from anon users, then anon users will not see the hover at all. I'm raising this as JRADEV-2084 specifically states that the goal is consistency with Confluence.
fields.summary: User hover is inconsistent for anonymous users between JIRA and Confluence

fields.description:
Cog menu icons in gadgets (e.g. Filter Results) have a {{title="Actions (Type . to access issue actions)"}} attribute. This displays a tooltip to the user when they hover their cursor over this icon.

There is no way to invoke said issue actions via the "." keyboard shortcut.

fields.description:
For example:

1) Open the "comment" dialog.
2) Type in a comment and press the preview button.
3) Click the "shortcut tip" link.

The user data is lost without a dirty form warning.

This applies anywhere a dirty form check is made (e.g. Edit Issue, Transitions, Edit Comment)
fields.summary: Comment fields in preview mode are not considered "dirty"
Log XSRF token timeouts as warn instead of ERROR to avoid "noise" in the logs

fields.description:
Current behaviour:
* when accessed anonymously I get 404 for a project which cannot be browsed anonymously (Group: {{Anyone}} in JIRA.  At the same time, REST gives me the hint that:
{quote}
"You must have the browse project permission to view this project."
{quote}
* when authenticated, but the user does not have the access to selected project, I get 404 too.

This is IMO inconsistent with [RFC2616|http://www.w3.org/Protocols/rfc2616/rfc2616-sec10.html] guidelines for using 403 vs. 404.
If we want to protect/hide the existence of a resource (project) which cannot be accessed anonymously or by the current user, we should say 404 without further hints. If we want to indicate that the user must be authenticated first, we should use 401, and if the user is already authenticated we should use 403. In both cases we should then include the message (the same which is sent now).

JIRA web UI does not hide the existence of the projects inaccessible anonymously or by the authenticated (but unauthorized) user, so we should do the same in REST too.
fields.summary: Error codes and message returned for failed attempts to access project resource are not conforming to RFC guidelines.
Record a WARN message in the logs when an action command is not found

fields.description: User should be somehow notified of this (as is the case for other issue actions from the issue navigator)
